humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, metastatic adenocarcinoma is found in 4 out of 16 total axillary lymph nodes (as per Rule 9 and New Rule 10). This corresponds to the N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12). The report also mentions one lymph node in the low axilla is macroscopically positive and exhibits extracapsular invasion by tumor, which supports the N1 stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic adenocarcinoma involving 4 out of 16 total axillary lymph nodes. This corresponds to N1 stage based on the TNM staging system for cancer, which classifies N1 as 'Metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes'.
